elements.title: Klassische Philharmonie Bonn (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the Klassische Philharmonie Bonn (pictured), a symphony orchestra founded and conducted by Heribert Beissel, has a tradition of playing a series of concerts at more than ten major halls in Germany?

elements.title: Herschel Prins (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that criminologist Herschel Prins found in 1993 that young black men at Broadmoor Hospital were often stereotyped as "big, black and dangerous"?

elements.title: The Fabulous Baker Boys (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that director Steve Kloves was reluctant to cast Beau Bridges as the brother of Jeff Bridges's character in The Fabulous Baker Boys because he thought it sounded like "a gimmick"?

elements.title: Muhammad Sadiq (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Muhammad Sadiq's photographs were the first ever taken of the Islamic holy sites in Mecca and Medina?

elements.title: RSS Panglima (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that RSS Panglima was the first ship of the Republic of Singapore Navy?

elements.title: Joni Albrecht (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that a resolution introduced into the Nebraska Legislature by Joni Albrecht praised Julie Schmit-Albin as "never one to let a public official waffle on pro-life legislation"?

elements.title: birdfoot buttercup (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the birdfoot buttercup is found on three continents, mostly in the Arctic zone?

elements.title: Junk (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the cast and crew of the zombie film Junk, which made use of real meat for its gore effects, were sometimes unable to stomach meat for dinner after spending hours filming?

elements.title: 14岁跳水天才全红婵终圆童年梦：网友看完心疼不已 (快科技)
elements.contents:

elements.title: 30岁女子每天跳绳1000个致骨折：医院一查难以置信 (快科技)
elements.contents:
